newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss shares close stronger, SMI gains 3.3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Swiss shares close stronger, SMI gains 3.3 pct.

text.p: 1445 GMT - Swiss shares recovered on Tuesday from losses the day before and jumped about three percent on the blue-chip Swiss Market Index (SMI).
Dealers said positive U.S. financial markets on Monday, Wall Street's firm opening on Tuesday and derivatives-related buying supported the market.
The correction seemed to be over, one dealer said.
The blue-chip SMI advanced 174.5 points or 3.32 percent to reach 5,580.1 points.
The all-share Swiss Performance Index rose 94.09 points or 2.69 percent to close at 3,586.10.
The market was also supported by a stronger dollar and growing optimism that German and U.S. interest rates might not rise, despite earlier speculation of rate moves.
Dealers said share prices might drop a little on Wednesday in profit-taking after the day's gains.

Chemicals and pharma shares profited from the recovery. Novartis, which was most traded, rose 117 francs to 2,252. Roche advanced 285 francs to close at 13,600. Clariant rose 55 francs to 1,064. Ciba jumped 8.25 francs to 138.
Industrials like Oerlikon and Sulzer were also stronger.
